clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Performance of a Robotic Flexible Ureteroscopy (ILY) in Laser Treatment of Nephrolithiasis
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Performance of a Robotic Flexible Ureteroscopy (ILY) in Laser Treatment of Nephrolithiasis in the Upper Urinary Tract

brief_summary.textblock: In this pilot study, we wish to evaluate the performance of a robotic flexible ureteorscopy (ILY) in the treatment of nephrolithiasis in the superior excretory system

primary_outcome.measure: Number of procedures performed entirely using the telemanipulator
Number of procedures where the surgeon had to switch to manual mode or dedock the device
If telemanipulator remained stable during procedure
primary_outcome.time_frame: end of procedure; less than 2 hours
end of procedure; less than 2 hours
end of procedure; less than 2 hours
primary_outcome.description: time between docking of device and use of gamepad

primary_outcome.measure: Time taken to track kidney stones
primary_outcome.time_frame: end of procedure; less than 2 hours

primary_outcome.measure: Time taken for complete exploration of renal cavities
primary_outcome.time_frame: end of procedure; less than 2 hours
end of procedure; less than 2 hours
end of procedure; less than 2 hours

primary_outcome.measure: Any joint pain strain experienced by the surgeon before and after intervention
primary_outcome.time_frame: end of procedure; less than 2 hours

primary_outcome.measure: Satisfaction of surgeon in using the device
primary_outcome.time_frame: end of procedure; less than 2 hours
primary_outcome.description: Custom-made questionnaire with 3 sections measuring: ease of use, ergonomics in exploration of renal cavities and stability during fragmentation of laser

secondary_outcome.measure: Describe the rate of intra-operative complications during procedure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: end of procedure; less than 2 hours

secondary_outcome.measure: Describe the rate of intra-operative complications
Integrity of the ureroscope at the end of the procedure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: end of procedure; less than 2 hours

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The patient must have given their free and informed consent and signed the consent form
- The patient must be a member or beneficiary of a health insurance plan
- The patient is at least 18 years old
- The patient has a single kidney stone in the calyx or the pelvis between 5 and 15mm something to do with a JJ probe
- Patient has an indication for in situ lithotripsy by supply ureteroscopy
Exclusion Criteria:
- The subject is participating in an interventional study, or is in a period of exclusion determined by a previous study
- The patient is under safeguard of justice or state guardianship
- The subject refuses to sign the consent
- It is impossible to give the subject informed information
- The patient is pregnant or breastfeeding
- Patient treated with anticoagulants
- Documented untreated urinary infection within the previous 48 hours
